Homage to TathÄgata SatyarÅ«padharmaÅ›reá¹£á¹­ha If there are people who, with regard to the names of these innumerable and boundless TathÄgatas who have arisen,
receive and uphold them themselves, recite them, contemplate them, and practice them with mindfulness, they will not have eye problems, ear and nose problems, tongue problems,
body problems, and all obstacles will be completely purified. All people will be unable to subdue them, and they will also attain irreversibility from supreme, perfect
enlightenment. The World-Honored Buddhas of the ten directions will always remember them and always provide protection for those beings.
Those Buddhas will reveal inconceivable skillful means of wisdom to them even in their dreams, and they will quickly attain the samÄdhi and dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gates.
They will always be in the presence of the buddhas, and in the Buddha's teachings, they will be born from a great jeweled lotus flower. Wherever they are born, they will

never be apart from the thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics of a great person. They will have spiritual powers and the five eyes to teach and transform sentient beings, and they will purify buddha-lands, practice the perfections and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and be
never apart from meditation, immeasurable samÄdhis, formless concentrations, and so forth. They will not
abandon the various powers, fearlessnesses, analytical knowledges, eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, and immeasurable asaá¹ƒkhyeyas.
According to the great Sui method of counting, one asaá¹ƒkhyeya is equal to ten billion trillion. They will never be apart from all the buddhadharmas.

Those tathÄgata arhat perfectly enlightened ones will have all those merits and virtues, and they will attain peace and bliss, and in this way they will attain supreme perfect enlightenment.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Homage to the TathÄgata VimalÄ!
If one recites his name, one will attain inexhaustible wisdom.
Homage to the TathÄgata SÅ«ryacandrapradÄ«pa!
If one recites his name, one will attain irreversibility.
If a woman hears this Buddha's name, it will be her last female body, and she will not receive another.
Homage to the TathÄgata Amá¹›tameru!
If one recites his name, even if the world were filled with gold leaf and one were to give it away with the seven precious materials, it would not equal even a kalÄ of merit.
Homage to the TathÄgata Samantagandha!

If one recites the name of that Buddha TathÄgata, immeasurable fragrance will emerge from all one's pores, one will receive the fragrance of all Buddha lands, and one will attain immeasurable and boundless merit.
Homage to the TathÄgata ViÅ›uddhaprabhÄ!

If one praises the name of that Buddha TathÄgata, the merit obtained is not even one-sixteenth of the merit of filling worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with the seven treasures and giving them away, by merely uttering the name of that Buddha TathÄgata.
Homage to the TathÄgata DharmeÅ›vara!
If one praises the name of that Buddha TathÄgata, all the Buddha Dharmas will be completely fulfilled.
Homage to the TathÄgata MahÄsaá¹ƒgha!
If one praises the name of that Buddha TathÄgata, all the Buddha Dharmas will be completely fulfilled.
Homage to the TathÄgata Ananta-gandha-prabhÄsa!
Those who praise his name will attain irreversibility.
Homage to the TathÄgata Agni-prabhÄsa!
If one praises the name of that Buddha TathÄgata, one's immeasurable accumulation of merit will increase day and night.
Homage to the TathÄgata Soma-pradÄ«pa!
If one praises the name of that Buddha TathÄgata, one will be a field of merit in the world.

If there are good men and good women who practice the vehicle of bodhisattvas, and those who recite the name of the Tathagata, Arhat, Samyak-sambuddha Ratnaprabha-chandra-vyuha-tejorasmi-vikramin, and the verses of this dharani, and having heard them, believe and understand, they will, after leaving this life, attain the position of a wheel-turning king;

They will encounter a Buddha appearing in the world, and having seen the Tathagata, they will make immeasurable offerings and service, cultivate pure conduct, and reach the other shore of all spiritual powers;
They will also attain a dharani called the Ten Turnings;

Having seen the TathÄgata, they will make inconceivable offerings, will see buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges River, will transcend such koá¹­is of kalpas of flowing through birth and death, and their minds will not forget anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi;
they will attain a body as solid as NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, with only one bone difficult to bend, their body golden in color, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man;
they will attain the voice of BrahmÄ, leave the state of no leisure, and attain leisure.
And he spoke a verse, saying:
If for seven days and seven nights one utters the name of that TathÄgata,
one will attain the pure and wondrous heavenly eye, praised by the Buddha of boundless pure eyes.
Having attained the pure heavenly eye, that person's fleshly eye will also be pure,
and they will see immeasurable and boundless buddhas, their number like the sands of the Ganges River.
All made offerings to those buddhas, and what they heard they all upheld.
Those whom the eyes saw, no one did not greet with kind words.
In the past, they had already made offerings to the buddhas, and the inconceivable deeds they did,
all they attained through the power of recollection, all due to hearing the names of those tathÄgatas.

At that time, Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, MaÃ±juÅ›rÄ« KumÄrabhÅ«ta, Bodhisattva DhÄraá¹‡Ä«Å›vara, and Bodhisattva VajrapÄá¹‡i, the four bodhisattvas, and the four tathÄgatas beginning with JÃ±ÄnÄrciá¹£, were dwelling in the palace of the sun and moon.

At that time, the two celestial sons Sun and Moon went to where the TathÄgata and the bodhisattvas were. They saw the TathÄgata and the others each sitting on a lion throne adorned with jewels, in the JambÅ«nada chariot, and the bodhisattvas.
At that time, the two celestial sons Sun and Moon each had this thought:

'How can we, in the presence of this TathÄgata and the bodhisattvas, obtain a dhÄraá¹‡Ä« called Bestowing Light to All Sentient Beings, Dispelling Great Darkness, Most Wonderful and Supreme, Circulating in the Ten Directions, which, by its power, will bestow great light and create great illumination for sentient beings?'

At that time, Samantabhadra Bodhisattva said to the two celestial princes of the sun and moon:
All you sons of good family!
This dhÄraá¹‡Ä« has already been spoken by 88 million buddhas out of compassion for sentient beings.
All you sons of good family!
The udumbara flower can be easily obtained, but this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra is truly difficult to give rise to.
All you sons of good family!
This dhÄraá¹‡Ä« mantra is also easy to give rise to, but if one receives and upholds this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« and recites it, that is also very difficult.
All you sons of good family!
The appearance of a buddha in the world is not difficult, but the appearance of this dhÄraá¹‡Ä« is very difficult.
All you sons of good family!

If there are people who create uninterrupted [karma] for the beings in AvÄ«ci Hell, who slander the true Dharma, and who dwell for a kalpa to benefit those beings, reciting these dhÄraá¹‡Ä« phrases twenty-one days, three times a day and three times a night, warming up their studies day by day, at that time, the great AvÄ«ci Hell, by the majestic power of the dhÄraá¹‡Ä«, will be shattered into a hundred pieces, and those beings will immediately attain liberation.
How much more so for the people of JambudvÄ«pa! If they touch the gateway of the ears, they should know as follows:
We have already been accepted by the four TathÄgatas, as well as by the four Bodhisattvas and the two celestial bodies of the sun and moon.
Do not give rise to doubt in this matter.

This dharani chapter was proclaimed, explained, and rejoiced in by all Buddhas.

If there are good men and good women who uphold this dhÄraá¹‡Ä«, they will have nothing to fear from any ghosts or spirits. In this life they will behold AmitÄbha Buddha, and will also get to see AvalokiteÅ›vara face to face, as well as Candraprabha KumÄra. They will go from one excellent place to another excellent place, encountering good spiritual friends among all the wholesome dharmas. If they are women, they will attain the transformation of the female body. This is the power of the TathÄgata Sandalwood Fragrance, and they will also attain the boundless excellent states of bodhisattvas.
Good sons!
This dhÄraá¹‡Ä« chapter was spoken, upheld, and rejoiced in by the Buddhas of the Ganges sands, in order to bring benefit to those beings who have fallen into the evil destinies.
Good sons!
If there are bodhisattvas who uphold this dhÄraá¹‡Ä«, they will transcend eight kinds of terrors, namely:

The terrors of the boundless hells, the terrors of the boundless animal realm, the terrors of the boundless hungry ghost realm, the terrors of the boundless womb, the terrors of the boundless birth, the terrors of the boundless old age, the terrors of the boundless sickness, the terrors of the boundless death.
The Buddhas of the ten directions all think of that person. At the time of death, their mind is not confused or disturbed, and they face the Buddhas.
They will attain an inexhaustible body in their next life, and they will also be able to subdue their faculties.

Shaha These Buddhas, when they were practicing the bodhisattva path in the past, made such a vow:

'After we have realized enlightenment, if there are sentient beings who hear our names, uphold them with pure faith, they will all attain irreversibility, transcend the eight inopportune states, be protected, remembered, and upheld by all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, be reborn in pure Buddha lands, and after leaving that life, be guarded by all the devas and transcend all fears.

' If there are people who uphold the names of these Buddhas, as well as the dharani verses and chapters, and remember them without forgetting, if they wish to see Maitreya Bodhisattva, those people should recite this dharani one hundred thousand times, making offerings according to their ability;
if they wish to see Samantabhadra Bodhisattva, those people should recite it two hundred thousand times, making offerings according to their ability;
If one further wishes to see Vairocana TathÄgata, that person should recite it 300,000 times and make offerings according to one's ability.
Having attained a pure mind, one should give rise to a compassionate mind, abandon all arrogance, anger, jealousy, resentment, and afflictions, and so forth.
